newsitem.title: UK: Prudential admits errors in pension sales - paper.
newsitem.headline: Prudential admits errors in pension sales - paper.

text.p: Insurance group Prudential Corp Plc admitted it had mis-sold pensions to the public, The Daily Telegraph reported on Thursday.

The newspaper said Prudential owned up to the mistakes in its direct sales of pensions products after a draft report by the Securities & Investment Board (SIB), expressing worries that staff had wrongly advised clients, was leaked.
"We have made some mistakes and we are sorting them out," a spokesman told the newspaper.
"There are some issues in the SIB document that we need to address but we cannot comment on those specifically until a final report if produced," he added.
The SIB report, which followed a two-month investigation, concerned clients who were advised to invest in a high selling product rather than more suitable investments.

"The product is linked to Pru's life fund and so is believed to suffer from the underlying taxation applied to the fund," the newspaper said, adding that some people could have been disadvantaged by it.
The report also looked into procedures where clients may have incurred new charges by salesmen for selling second pensions instead of topping up their initial pension.
